body_html:
@pachpandepriti I'm afraid you'll have to slice the input to fft/ifft like so:

fft_size = 256
# A [batch_size, num_frames, frame_length] signal. 
x = tf.random_normal([1, 24000, 512])
# Take the 1D DFT of the inner dimension with a 256-point FFT. 
# Without the slice, a 512-point FFT would be taken, since the inner dimension is 512.
s = tf.spectral.fft(x[:, :, :fft_size])

Adding an fft_length parameter to tf.spectral.fft and tf.spectral.ifft has been on my TODO list for a while, though.

body:
@pachpandepriti I'm afraid you'll have to slice the input to `fft`/`ifft` like so:
```python
fft_size = 256
# A [batch_size, num_frames, frame_length] signal. 
x = tf.random_normal([1, 24000, 512])
# Take the 1D DFT of the inner dimension with a 256-point FFT. 
# Without the slice, a 512-point FFT would be taken, since the inner dimension is 512.
s = tf.spectral.fft(x[:, :, :fft_size])
```

Adding an `fft_length` parameter to `tf.spectral.fft` and `tf.spectral.ifft` has been on my TODO list for a while, though.
